Message.Title: Senate endorses Keystone XL pipeline construction
Message.Msg: Senate endorses Keystone XL pipeline construction Posted on March 22, 2013 at 5:58 pm by Associated Press in Keystone XL Comments(1) A crewman directs a pipe on a site for TransCanada's Keystone XL project in Wood County, Texas. (Cody Duty / Houston Chronicle) WASHINGTON (AP) â€” The Senate has endorsed construction of the proposed Keystone XL pipeline that is to carry oil from Canada to Texas oil refineries. Senators voted 62-37 on Friday for the nonbinding measure. Seventeen Democrats and all 45 Republicans voted yes. For four years, environmentalists and others have tried to derail the project, saying extracting the oil from Alberta tar sands would increase global warming. President Barack Obama has thwarted it twice, and Nebraska officials objected initially that the route would jeopardize ecologically sensitive lands. But the Nebraska route has been changed, and project supporters have won more backing by arguing it would create thousands of jobs. A recent State Department report raised no major objections to the project. North Dakota Republican Sen. John Hoeven sponsored the measure. fuelfixDOTcom/blog/2013/03/22/senate-endorses-keystone-xl-pipeline-construction/

Topic.Title: Ptivate banks can directly tax citizens

Message.Msg: A bank's default on its loans is not a tax, which is what a bank's failure to honor its deposits is. The solution is to recapitalize the bank with a tax, or to let it collapse.

Message.Title: The most undisciplined big society on the planet
Message.Msg: It's clear which one this is and it is also clear what will be the result. - centers of cultural degeneracy such as Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Oakland, Chicago, Detroit, Harlem, Philadelphia, Washington DC, Atlanta, Houston, Miami.... The list is endless. The result is societal failure, the collapse of female culture especially, the production of endless swarms of idle and useless youths, rapidly rising crime rates, and the creation of fiscal black holes that suck money in from stronger outside communities dragging them down too.... The entire system of capitalism is built on projecting forward the prospects for a society's potential, and assigning a risk premium on its prospects, and the prospects of its corporations, banks, and governmental infrastructure. The system can only be tricked so long into assigning an incorrect risk premium, interest rate, and price on the assets of the society. How you fix the mess above is very simple. The method is the method used by Europe to lift itself out of the middle ages: taxes, government regulation, and the subsidization of culture, education, and technology on a massive scale by redistributing income from the poor and culturally useless to the superior classes in society. There is a problem, however, when you introduce the element of democracy. People are not likely to vote for such iron discipline, especially when they will be on the receiving end of it.

Topic.Title: The most undisciplined big society on the planet

Message.Msg: The government is preparing for the end game with bullets, FEMA camps, drones, black helicopters, etc. The food lines (food stamps) are masked as a " look what your country is doing for you" prop. With trillions in debt, our budget deficit steadily banging on the front castle gates and a growing population of "you owe me" clones, we are headed downhill fast. Our Government has shown their Trump Card (the state America really is in) when they started crying over the measly sequester cuts...which was tiny and a fraud in itself. Oh, did I mention the war drums steadily beating........to the tune of Bomb Bomb Bomb......Bomb Bomb Iran. We can't afford another war and I think the whole world knows it.

Topic.Title: The most undisciplined big society on the planet

Message.Msg: The U.S. military is now supplying Germany with the best of the best of its drone technology and the Bundeswehr is building up its arsenal, as well as erecting a fiscal and economic fortress to weather storms (note the balanced budget and the plane loads of gold on their way from New York to the Bundesbank vaults in Frankfurt). German defense and industrial labs are working to improve the drones, develop better power cells, and laser applications using quantum physics. Perhaps someday the U.S. government will require assistance, and possibly even with German military bases on its own soil.

Message.Title: XOM's Tillerson has to go -- responsible for a major loss of shareholder value during his 6 years as CEO
Message.Msg: Rex Tillerson should be granted his golden severance and booted immediately. His XTO deal has sapped shareholder gains over the last 6 years. In 2006 when he became CEO, XOM was far more valuable than CVX on a per share basis. Now CVX has grown significantly and XOM has remained flat, the Tillerson slump. Tillerson has held back dividend growth so he could feed huge share buybacks to prop up the slumping per-share results of his malfeasance. Meanwhile, he has paid himself $20+ mil a year. He paid top dollar for XTO and it will take decades to recover from that miscalculation. Throw the bum out. Pay him off and lets get a new CEO who respects shareholder value and payout. In this week's Barron's, Tillerson was dropped from the "Best CEOs in the World" List. How embarrassing. Wall Street knows that he is no bright light, no Lee Raymond. He is no visionary leader, and he is even a bad caretaker. And he has run XOM into a wall. In late April XOM SHOULD announce a big catch-up dividend hike of 50% or greater to get the stuck shares back on a growth track. The share buyback program should be drastically reduced - it doesn't help shareholders; it only helps make subpar per-share earnings results look better, to make ineffective management look good. We need a div yield at 3.5% to move this stock over 100 finally. But this may not happen until Tillerson is thrown out. WRITE A LETTER TO XOM BOARD MEMBERS TO GET SOME ACTION GOING.
